job_title: Child and Youth Counsellor in Calgary, AB
pros: Free Training (i.e., ASSIST, First Aid, TCI, Indigenous education). Pay and benefits are decent. Free food.
cons: New employees are subject to a lengthy evalution process (i.e., CSOP training). You must master each phase before going onto the next. Often your co-workers grade you on every shift, not your supervisor. You must work a minimum of three months before accessing any benefits. Can be traumatic when having to do a restraint on youth. Shifts are from 7am-3pm or 3-11pm. Weekly shift rotation.
